qna.a: Thank you for your interest in housing or adopting refugees. We have received a number of inquiries like yours recently, and it is heartening to see so many people willing to open their homes and their lives to these brave men, women, and children fleeing war, persecution and violence around the world. The U.S. government manages resettlement to the United States, working with state and local partners around the country.  UNHCR, however, does not decide who gets accepted for resettlement to the U.S., and doesn’t work directly with resettled refugees in the U.S. If you want to help refugees that are already in the U.S., the best place to start is with a refugee resettlement agency in your city or state. You can find a list of agencies helping refugees here: http://www.acf.hhs.gov/programs/orr/state-programs-annual-overview

qna.a: Established by concerned American citizens, USA for UNHCR is a 501(c) (3) non-profit organization, headquartered in Washington, D.C. that helps and protects refugees and people displaced by violence, conflict and persecution. Supporting UNHCR – the UN Refugee Agency – and its partners, USA for UNHCR provides lifesaving essentials including shelter, water, food, safety and protection.

qna.a: USA for UNHCR was created in 1989 to inform the American people of the work of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the needs and circumstances of refugees around the world. USA for UNHCR is authorized by UNHCR to raise funds and awareness, and to advocate for refugees in the U.S. USA for UNHCR is not authorized to work with refugees and asylum seekers regarding any status, protection or asylum requests.

qna.a: We sincerely appreciate your kind concern for asylum seekers fleeing Central America. UNHCR is on the ground responding to this growing crisis in countries like Honduras, Guatemala and El Salvador. We continue to call on governments to work together and address the root causes of flight from Central America and at the same time ensure safe haven for families fleeing this life-threatening violence and persecution. Learn more by visiting our emergencies page https://www.unrefugees.org/emergencies/central-america/.

qna.a:
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, has stepped up relief efforts throughout the region, and with your
support they can continue their vital work for Venezuelans. Working with the Colombian government,
UNHCR has supported the registration of 440,000 Venezuelans. UNHCR-supported facilities in Colombia
are helping serve thousands of meals each day and providing psychiatric care to people in need. In
Brazil, UNHCR has supported the construction of more than a dozen temporary shelters, providing site
planning management and humanitarian aid items. In the face of uncertainty these brave men, women,
and children travel long and often terrifying journeys in search of safety. When they finally reach it, your
gifts help provide lifesaving services and the tools to build a better, safer future for themselves and their
families. Know more about the Venezuelan refugee crisis at https://www.unrefugees.org/emergencies/venezuela/ .

alt.markdown: UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, has stepped up relief efforts throughout the region, and with your support they can continue their vital work for Venezuelans. Working with the Colombian government, UNHCR has supported the registration of 440,000 Venezuelans. UNHCR-supported facilities in Colombia are helping serve thousands of meals each day and providing psychiatric care to people in need. In Brazil, UNHCR has supported the construction of more than a dozen temporary shelters, providing site planning management and humanitarian aid items. In the face of uncertainty these brave men, women, and children travel long and often terrifying journeys in search of safety. When they finally reach it, your gifts help provide lifesaving services and the tools to build a better, safer future for themselves and their families. Know more about the Venezuelan refugee crisis here .

qna.a: Unfortunately, the UN Refugee Agency is unable to accept material donations. When providing lifesaving supplies to refugees, the UN Refugee Agency has in place procurement mechanisms that allow us to purchase exactly what refugees need locally. This ensures refugees are receiving the type of assistance they need most at the moment they need it and, as is the case with many emergencies, those needs can change quickly depending on weather, environment and scale of the crisis. We sincerely appreciate your desire to support refugees. Please visit our “How To Help” web page to learn about other ways you can assist refugees. (https://www.unrefugees.org/how-to-help/)

alt.markdown: Unfortunately, the UN Refugee Agency is unable to accept material donations. When providing lifesaving supplies to refugees, the UN Refugee Agency has in place procurement mechanisms that allow us to purchase exactly what refugees need locally. This ensures refugees are receiving the type of assistance they need most at the moment they need it and, as is the case with many emergencies, those needs can change quickly depending on weather, environment and scale of the crisis. We sincerely appreciate your desire to support refugees. Please visit our “How To Help” web page to learn about other ways you can assist refugees.

qna.a:
Three million men, women, and children have been forced to flee their homes because of the conflict in
Yemen. More than 15 million are on the brink of starvation, and sadly, 400,000 children are among
those suffering from the most severe form of malnutrition. The United Nations calls Yemen "the world's
worst humanitarian crisis," and approximately 75 percent of the population requires humanitarian
assistance. As this crisis continues, your support will help UNHCR address the critical needs of these
vulnerable families struggling to survive. Know more about the Yemen refugee crisis at https://www.unrefugees.org/emergencies/yemen/ .

alt.markdown: Three million men, women, and children have been forced to flee their homes because of the conflict in Yemen. More than 15 million are on the brink of starvation, and sadly, 400,000 children are among those suffering from the most severe form of malnutrition. The United Nations calls Yemen "the world's worst humanitarian crisis," and approximately 75 percent of the population requires humanitarian assistance. As this crisis continues, your support will help UNHCR address the critical needs of these vulnerable families struggling to survive. Know more about the Yemen refugee crisis here .

qna.a:
USA for UNHCR is committed to using your money as efficiently and effectively as possible to help
refugees in need. When USA for UNHCR is fundraising for a specific emergency or crisis, 100% of
6
designated restricted donations will apply to that particular emergency or crisis. Should USA for UNHCR
raise funds in excess of what is required to respond to that particular crisis, the remaining funds are
redirected to where the need is greatest.
You can find out more about what your donations have achieved at https://www.unrefugees.org/what-we-do/.
If you believe your gift was made in error, or have additional questions, please contact our Donor Care
team at 1-855-808-6427.

qna.a: In 1949, the UN General Assembly established UNRWA, United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees, specifically to support Palestine refugees in its five areas of operation in Jordan, Lebanon, the Syrian Arab Republic, West Bank and the Gaza Strip. It was created as a UN agency separate from UNHCR as the number of Palestinian refugees after WWII was so large, which is now 5 around 5 million people. UNHCR supports refugees in all other areas, including Palestinian refugees in countries other than those states/areas noted above. Know more about UNRWA at https://www.unrwa.org/.

alt.markdown: In 1949, the UN General Assembly established UNRWA, United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees, specifically to support Palestine refugees in its five areas of operation in Jordan, Lebanon, the Syrian Arab Republic, West Bank and the Gaza Strip. It was created as a UN agency separate from UNHCR as the number of Palestinian refugees after WWII was so large, which is now 5 around 5 million people. UNHCR supports refugees in all other areas, including Palestinian refugees in countries other than those states/areas noted above. Know more about UNRWA at here.

q: What is UNRWA?

qna.a:
UNHCR is the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees - the UN Refugee Agency. UNICEF is the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund. UNICEF’s mandate is to advocate for the protection of children's rights, to help meet their basic needs and to expand their opportunities to reach their full potential.

UNHCR is a separate organization with a unique mission. UNHCR was founded in 1950, to assist refugees in the aftermath of WWII. Ever since, the UN Refugee Agency has been called to serve the world’s most vulnerable people, including refugees, internally displaced persons, stateless people.
q: What is the difference between UNICEF and UNHCR?
